name: Mithril Coat
description: A rare and incredibly strong chainmail shirt made from mithril, worn by Frodo Baggins.

content.title: Overview
content.body: The Mithril Coat, also known as the Mithril shirt or mailhauberk, is a finely woven chainmail garment crafted from mithril, a legendary and supernaturally strong metal. It was a gift from Bilbo Baggins to Frodo and serves as an exceptional protective armor during perilous journeys in Middle-earth. The coat is light as silk yet more protective than the strongest steel.

content.title: Appearance
content.body: Though resembling ordinary chainmail, the Mithril Coat shines with a subtle silvery sheen indicative of its extraordinary craftsmanship and precious metal composition. Its intricate links are forged so finely that it fits snugly without restricting movement, allowing for both protection and agility. The coat is surprisingly lightweight, defying typical expectations of armored mail.

content.title: Function
content.body: The coat provides unparalleled defense against blades, arrows, and other weapons, essentially making the wearer near-invulnerable in battle. It dissipates kinetic energy and resists cuts and punctures, offering critical protection to Frodo during his dangerous quest. Its lightweight nature ensures the wearer’s mobility isn’t compromised while offering exceptional safeguarding.

content.title: History
content.body: The Mithril Coat was originally forged by the dwarves of Khazad-dûm during the ancient days of Middle-earth, their skill unmatched in working with mithril. It came into the possession of Bilbo who wore it during The Hobbit and then bestowed it upon Frodo Baggins for his quest in The Lord of the Rings. It proved to be instrumental in saving Frodo’s life on multiple occasions.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: The Mithril Coat symbolizes rare craftsmanship and the protective bonds among the Fellowship. Its function extends beyond physical defense, representing the hope and endurance of Frodo amidst overwhelming darkness. The coat’s gift from Bilbo to Frodo also signifies the passing of courage and responsibility between generations in Tolkien’s epic.
